title: Snapchat's international arm posts losses of £244m but doubles sales
text:
Snapchat’s international business enjoyed a surge in sales last year - despite posting heavy losses of more than $300m (£244m).

Snap Inc’s UK-based overseas arm, which oversees all the company’s business outside the US, saw revenues nearly double from $203m to $403m as the photo-sharing and messaging app grew its advertising sales following a divisive redesign last year.

Accounts filed to Companies House showed the division also reported a loss of $314m in 2018. Losses are not unusual for tech firms, which burn through billions of pounds a year as they seek to grow market share amid cut-throat competition.

A botched redesign last year threatened to derail the Silicon Valley firm as users baulked...
